The claim was made by U: S. Rep. Tom Price during a C-SPAN call-in show on June 29.
The claim has been used by multiple poli: including presidential hopefuls Ron Paul, Jon Huntsman, and Michele Bachmann, as well as U.S. Sen. Saxby Chambliss.
The claim is based on a partisan estimat: CBO) that suggested the IRS "would probably" need to spend "between $5 billion and $10 billion over 10 years" to implement the health care law.
